alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Central Piscataquis; Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northern Piscataquis; Northern Somerset; Northern Washington; Northwest Aroostook; Southeast Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 07 at 2:54PM EDT until October 08 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Aroostook, Piscatiquis, Northern and Central Penobscot, and Northern Somerset and Washington Counties. * WHEN...From 6 PM EDT this evening through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Locally heavy rainfall will begin by late this afternoon and this evening, continuing into Sunday morning before tapering off by early Sunday afternoon. Around 1 to 3.5 inches of rain are expected, with locally up to around 5 inches of rain possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
